Imagine my surprise when playing around with the Ubuntu distro in WSL, I find out that 50% of my memory at idle is in use. I have 16GB of memory. Anything above 30% at idle should be an anomaly. Thankfully, Simon Peter Debbarma outlines a way to limit the amount of RAM that the WSL distro can access at any given time.
